pros:
- friendly work environment
- flexibility in teaching
cons:

job_title: Chef De Partie in Keene, TX
pros: Kind people to work with & positive environment with Christian values. My department was flexible and fun to work in!
cons: Taking vacation time must revolve around academic calendar due to campus needs -- not a deal breaker but something to keep in mind!

job_title: Residence Hall Assistant in Keene, TX
pros: Get to know students, Boss is the best on the Campus, and get to work with amazing people.
cons: Late nights and sometimes you don't get along with your coworkers.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Keene, TX
cons: Last minute assignments while at the job

pros: Travel, hotels, stipends, rentals, on the go. Can build your credit
cons: Politics, student loan debt, some judgemental Christians, holier than thou attitude at times.

pros: Chill and respectable coworkers and bosses, and working job isn't too difficult
cons: Personally felt discriminated against the color of my skin/race.

review_title: Great place to work for college students
job_title: Student Graphic Designer in Keene, TX
pros: I worked here back when I was a freshman. I had zero experience but I was almost immediately hired to work in their marketing department. My coworkers were amazing people, and my boss was very flexible with balancing the work and study life. They allowed me to train myself on using the adobe software for design purposes. It was a very laid back and relaxed environment.
cons: Some days were busier than others, summer time was very slow. The pay was not great. I didn't really see much room to grown since it was a very small department.

review_title: The mission is important but poorly expressed
pros: The people are dedicated and like a family.  The students are some of the best in the nation.
cons: The president lacks judgement when it comes to hiring people.

pros: The overall environment of Southwestern is amazing, great staff, professors, and students.
cons: There are none, it was great working for a school who values their student workers as more than there to do the "dirty" work.

pros: Having campus jobs for students is a wonderful opportunity to gain work experience in college.
cons: You can only work if you are a student attending the school.

review_title: Enjoyed the environment and friends made through working!
pros: The environment was always very friendly and welcoming, not only the staff but fellow students as well.
cons: Positions are very limited, but there are no major cons to working at SWAU.

review_title: Minimum wage with no opportunity for more. Good location though.
cons: Wages, lack of advancement opportunity, most jobs only available to students

pros: Great environment. Flexibility to work with your schedule. And get people within the organization.
cons: Not very organized. Could use some help with in being more organized.

pros: I love working and helping the students.
cons: I work too far from my home.
